page.title: 08FULFORD HALL ,IVY HOUSE FARM
page.content: The Hall is an 18th Century brick built country house of classical proportions,with four south facing windows and attic dormers in the hipped tiled roof. The Hall is enlivened with stone detail ,including plinth,plat band,eaves cornice and keystones.Distinction and interest is added by a mature red brick wall linking the Hall to an attractive trick gazebo,embellished with stone quoins,plinth and eaves course and surmounted by a pyramidal roof. Ivy House Farm-sadly now derelict cottage.It features flamboyant crenellated chimneys,elaborate stone lintels and sills withpendant motifs including triglyphs and shield shapes. (triglyph=ornament on Doric frieze)
